intro: Coriflora baldwinii, commonly known as the Baldwin's coriflora, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
